Module IO
Package encryption

Record Class RSA

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Record
encryption.RSA
All Implemented Interfaces:
EncryptionStrategy
public record RSA(PublicKey publicKey, PrivateKey privateKey) extends Record implements EncryptionStrategy
This class represents an implementation of the EncryptionStrategy interface using the RSA encryption algorithm. RSA (Rivest-Shamir-Adleman) is a widely used public-key cryptosystem for secure data transmission.

  • Method Details

    • generateKeyPair

      public static KeyPair generateKeyPair(int keySize)
      Generates an RSA key pair with the specified key size.
      Parameters:
      keySize - The size of the RSA key pair to generate.
      Returns:
      A KeyPair containing the generated public and private keys.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if key pair generation fails.

    • encrypt

      public byte[] encrypt(byte[] data)
      Encrypts data using the RSA algorithm with the provided public key.
      Specified by:
      encrypt in interface EncryptionStrategy
      Parameters:
      data - The data to be encrypted.
      Returns:
      The encrypted data as a byte array.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if encryption fails.

    • decrypt

      public byte[] decrypt(byte[] data)
      Decrypts data using the RSA algorithm with the provided private key.
      Specified by:
      decrypt in interface EncryptionStrategy
      Parameters:
      data - The data to be decrypted.
      Returns:
      The decrypted data as a byte array.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if decryption fails.

    • publicKey

      public PublicKey publicKey()
      Gets the public key associated with this RSA encryption strategy.
      Returns:
      The public key used for encryption.

    • privateKey

      public PrivateKey privateKey()
      Gets the private key associated with this RSA encryption strategy.
      Returns:
      The private key used for decryption.

    • equals

      public final boolean equals(Object o)
      Indicates whether some other object is "equal to" this one. The objects are equal if the other object is of the same class and if all the record components are equal. All components in this record class are compared with Objects::equals(Object,Object).
      Specified by:
      equals in class Record
      Parameters:
      o - the object with which to compare
      Returns:
      true if this object is the same as the o argument; false otherwise.
